data.title: Cannot enter text when shadow dom enabled
data.body:
I am running atom 0.148 and when i enable shadow dom i can enter text into the new window without an issue.  If i close down atom and reopen.  Again text works perfectly but if i do the following i am unable to enter text via the keyboard

1) Open Atom
2) Open Folder location
3) Open .php or .txt or .js file from the opened folder
4) Most importantly, close the "untitled" empty tab.  As soon as this is closed text entry stops working.

I am running Windows 7 x64.

data.title: Help test the new Windows installer & auto-updater
data.body:
### Windows installer & auto-updater

:new: :checkered_flag: :electric_plug: :repeat: :tada:

The Atom installer and auto-updater for Windows is almost ready and could use some brave individuals to help test it out before it becomes official on atom.io as the preferred installation path.

If you have the time and energy to give it a spin please follow these instructions and comment on this issue with any problems you have or feedback on what could be better. :gift_heart:

These instructions were written against **Windows 8.1** but should work on Windows 7 as well. Please comment on this issue if they need to be altered for your Windows version or configuration. :video_camera:

The new installer & auto-updater are built using the [Squirrel for Windows](https://github.com/Squirrel/Squirrel.Windows) project. :squirrel:
### Uninstalling the Chocolatey installed Atom version

:fire: :chocolate_bar:

These instructions should only be performed if you've previously installed Atom using Chocolatey.
If you didn't you can skip to the **Installing Atom via the installer** section.

This will not cause you to lose any of your Atom settings since they are stored in `%UserProfile%\.atom` and that folder will not be touched during these steps.
1. Run `cuninst Atom` to uninstall Atom
2. Delete the `apm.bat` shim at `%Chocolatey%\bin\apm.bat`
3. Delete the **Open with Atom** context menu
   - Open a command prompt
   - Run `reg delete HKCR\*\shell\Atom /f`
   - Run `reg delete HKCR\directory\shell\Atom /f`
   - Run `reg delete HKCR\directory\background\shell\Atom /f`
4. Delete the Atom shortcut from the desktop
5. Delete the Atom shortcut from start menu at `%UserProfile%\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\GitHub, Inc`
### Installing Atom via the installer

This will not cause you to lose any of your Atom settings since they are stored in `%UserProfile%\.atom` and that folder will not be touched during these steps.
1. Download the **AtomSetup.exe** installer from the [0.149 releases page](https://github.com/atom/atom/releases/tag/v0.149.0)
2. Double click the installer once the download completes
3. You should see a loading gif appear after a couple seconds
4. The app should launch after about 15-45 seconds with an untitled editor
5. An Atom shortcut should be on the desktop
6. An Atom shortcut should be in the start menu under the **GitHub, Inc** section
7. `atom` and `apm` should now be on your `PATH`
   - Open a **new** command prompt or PowerShell window
   - `atom -v` should print out `0.149.0`
   - `apm -v` should print out a bunch of lines but the first one should be `apm 0.111.0`
8. The app itself is installed in `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom`

If any of these things don't happen for you please comment on this issue.

If you have install failures please include the file at `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom\SquirrelSetup.log` when reporting.
### Automatic Updates

The `0.149.0` version **should** automatically update when `0.150.0` is released. There are plans to add menu items for checking for updates similarly to the Mac app but for now it will auto-update silently in the background.

If you have update failures please include the file at `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom\SquirrelSetup.log` when reporting.
### Uninstalling the installer installed version

Follow these steps to completely uninstall the Atom version installed by the new installer.

You should follow these steps if something went wrong with the installer version or if you want to
go back to using a locally built version, a downloaded `.zip` version, or a Chocolately-installed version.

This will not cause you to lose any of your Atom settings since they are stored in `%UserProfile%\.atom` and that folder will not be touched during these steps.
1. Go to **Control Panel > Programs > Programs and Feature**
2. Select Atom
3. Right-click and click **Uninstall**
   ![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/5117303/98a7bebc-7007-11e4-8da7-9ac7f73966c5.png)
4. Delete `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom`
5. Atom is uninstalled.
6. The desktop shortcut, start menu shortcut, open with context menus should be gone and `atom` and `apm` should no longer be on the `PATH`.

Refs #3675

data.title: Remove space pen views from docs
data.body: They are now available at https://github.com/atom/space-pen and https://github.com/atom/atom-space-pen-views/blob/master/lib/scroll-view.coffee but will not be included in core in the 1.0.

data.title: Final API Pass
data.body:
Time to do a final API pass. Much of this work will fall out of converting packages in #3966 and #4011.

If you do some of this, post your findings under the following TODO heading.
### TODO
- [x] Deprecate `atom.workspaceView` and remove usage in core, including docs https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/4248
- [x] Remove space-pen-specific views from core docs and suggest [atom-space-pen-views](https://github.com/atom/atom-space-pen-views) instead.
- [x] Create `atom.tooltips` as the old ones no longer work with space-pen split out
- [x] Warn users of new space-pen when they attempt to trigger a command registered via the command registry 
- [x] Fix references to spacepen 3, use spacepen 4
- [x] Warn users when they `subscribeToCommand` on space-pen view
- [x] Warn users when they subscribe to commands via `on` with new space-pen?
- [x] Merge and release SpacePen 4 warnings PR @nathansobo 
- [x] Fix prose docs. Make sure they dont reference old APIs @nathansobo 
- [x] Add `.panes` -> `atom-pane-container` to selector linter
- [x] Add `.pane-row` / `.pane-column` -> `atom-pane-axis` with `.horizontal` or `.vertical` class
- [x] Remove Deprecations from core https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/4315
- [x] Need an alternative to workspaceView's `window:update-available` on atom, and other non-command ipc events. See https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/window-event-handler.coffee#L17 and https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/1406fbfe03232144c245fce2783abd7f818ba854/spec/atom-spec.coffee#L36 @nathansobo 
- [x] Fix `atom.commands.add` docs. They have 2 separate arg lists. Can merge? @benogle (likely update atomdoc) https://github.com/github/atom.io/pull/759
- [x] Update the styleguide to use new markup
- [x] Fix package generator. Make sure it doesnt use old APIs @benogle https://github.com/atom/apm/pull/225 and https://github.com/atom/space-pen-example-templates
- [x] Examples in tooltip manager api docs @benogle
- [x] What's up with the `.pane-item` selector?
- [x] Warn when people access deprecated views via the `$::view` method.
- [x] Add exceptions for outdated `::afterAttach` and `::beforeRemove` lifecycle hooks on new SpacePen views

data.title: Feature request: Most recently used (MRU) files and folders
data.body:
I would like to be able to find files or folders that I have recently opened in previous editing sessions. On Windows this is usually done under the File menu. For example: File > Recent Files > (displays a sub menu of top 10 most recently used files in descending order).

File

> Recent Files
>        > (top 10 most recent files)
> Recent Folders
>        > (top 10 most recent folders)

data.title: Write text async to selection clipboard
data.body:
Looks like Atom Shell's clipboard API uses sync ipc calls on Linux which causes the writing of selected text to the selection clipboard to add a non-trivial amount of time to the selection change event dispatch.

https://github.com/atom/atom-shell/blob/879de423728832cece6e798e3cbbb46e61738a16/atom/common/api/lib/clipboard.coffee#L3

Regarding this now being async, in my testing, this didn't change the behavior of middle mouse paste on Linux. The selection was still written to the clipboard before I could hit the paste button quick enough to paste the wrong text. But if this does present issues it could wait until the text is written before pasting the text on middle click.

Closes #4238

data.title: Remove the `normalizeIndentOnPaste` setting. Always do it.
data.body: Closes #4234.

data.title: Atom's code completion causes error: "No transaction open"
data.body:
Using Atom's completion is causing Atom to crash.
Going further with this issue, some times (randomly, I can't reproduce it more than one in each four tries), the editor starts acting really weird, not focusing the right tab, not saving when I hit Ctrl+S, etc...

Video: http://youtu.be/wmD8Q-RFoj0

data.title: Cursor dissapears after Alt+Tab
data.body:
After doing a Alt+Tab twice (switch to another window and then back to Atom) the cursor is lost (it doesn't appear on the screen, but input works fine).

Video: http://youtu.be/NVjuh4-M2q4

This is on Linux Arch x64 + KDE 4.14.x

data.title: Failure to install packages on Ubuntu due to node
data.body: Using Ubuntu 14.04 and apt-get to install utilities is causing problems to install and update packages for atom. This is due to ubuntu maintainers not updating regularly to the latest versions in a timely manner. As of this post the nodejs package is on 10.25 when the latest and atom used is the 10.33. Although npm also has similar issues from time to time I am only concerned for nodejs as of now. If it is at all possible to manage atom packages using nodejs 10.25+ it would facilitate linux users access.

data.title: Auto indent on paste fail with .yml
data.body:
I just tried to paste [the following content (click)](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/activeadmin/activeadmin/master/config/locales/de.yml) into a new `.yml` file and the result looked like this:

![bildschirmfoto 2014-11-19 um 09 34 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5446019/5102740/4e404dea-6fcf-11e4-9abb-7d8fdc6aa9cc.png)

With `Auto Indent On Paste` disabled i can paste it in and the format is ok.

data.title: Usability issue - unclear preference options
data.body: So as of 0.147 we now have two options, "Auto Indent On Paste" and "Normalize Indent On Paste." I have absolutely no idea what the difference is, or even what "normalize" means in this context. Just suggesting that maybe clearer captions below each option will help explain what these two options do.

data.title: Add special paste behavior when copying/cutting w/ no selection
data.body:
Addresses an issue pointed out by @dsandstrom in #4148.

@dsandstrom, @unDemian, if you wish to integrate this change into [clipboard-history](https://github.com/unDemian/clipboard-history), note that metadata field is called `fullLine`, not `fullline` as in @tekkub's [cut-line](https://github.com/tekkub/cut-line) package. I don't mean to be needlessly incompatible, but we always use camel-case identifiers, and I didn't want to break with that convention.

data.title: anchor zoom please
data.body:
1. zoom in really far on the middle of a document
2. select some text
3. ctrl+wheel zoom out and the selected text scrolls off the screen

in visual studio and wordpad and prob others it seems to be anchored to the top of the window while zooming so your selection and your 'focus' does not scroll out of view

please consider adding something similar

thanks

data.title: Restore correct indent behavior when inserting newlines
data.body:
When explicitly auto-indenting and when pasting, indentation is based
on the previous non-blank line. When simply inserting newlines,
the previous line is used, even if it is blank.

data.title: In whitespace-sensitive languages, indents are added incorrectly on newline insertion
data.body: ![indent](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/671378/5098647/e30e5a08-6f3d-11e4-91b7-9dce5d2f95ec.gif)

data.title: Drag and Drop selected text
data.body:
In Sublime text I can select text and drag and drop it to a new line.

This feature would be great to have in Atom. :)

data.title: Messages API: showing messages to the user
data.body:
As an extension of https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/4212 I am proposing an API for messaging the user. Usage is as simple as this:

``` coffee
atom.messages.add 'error', 'This is an error message'
```

Or, rather than passing in a type:

``` coffee
atom.messages.addError 'This is an error message'
```

There would be 5 types: fatal, error, warning, info, and success. 

Additionally, much more metadata could be attached to each message:

``` coffee
atom.messages.addError 'This is an error message',
  icon: 'bug'
  detail: 'Error on line 5 of /some/file.less'
  stack: # a stack trace
```

The `atom.messages` object would keep a list of all the messages, and emit events when one is added.

``` coffee
class Messages
  constructor: ->
    @messages = []
    @emitter = new Emitter

  onDidAddMessage: (callback) ->
    # ..

  addError: (messageString, options) ->
    message = new ErrorMessage(messageString, options)
    @messages.append(message)
    @emitter.emit('did-add-message', {type: 'error', message})
    message
```
### Rendering

Core does not need to render messages in the UI. The [atom/messages](https://github.com/atom/messages) package could render the messages. This gives the user the option to create a new message handling package.

data.title: Add onWillThrowError
data.body: This will allow packages to override the dev tools popping up behavior.

data.title: Port chocolatey install actions to squirrel events
data.body:
The new squirrel installer installs to `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom` and currently only handles creating start menu and desktop shortcuts.

This PR adds the remaining items that were previously managed by the chocolatey install script.
- Adds an **Open with Atom** file context menu.
- Adds an **Open with Atom** folder context menu.
- Adds `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom\bin` to the `Path` environment variable.
  - Uses `setx` to set the `Path` in the registry.
- Adds a command shim from `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom\bin\atom.cmd` to the latest installed `atom.exe` version since `atom.exe` changes paths on each update.
- Adds a command shim from `%UserProfile%\AppData\Local\atom\bin\apm.cmd` to the latest installed `apm.cmd` version since `apm.cmd` changes paths on each update.

Once Atom ships with this and any bumps are smoothed out, this will be extracted into Atom Shell and added as helper on the `auto-updater` module.

Closes #4180

data.title: Deprecate style sheet event methods on ThemeManager
data.body: Global style sheet handling has now been moved to `StyleManager` and relies on interaction with the `<atom-styles>` element. The `ThemeManager` now focuses only on loading themes. This PR makes the new methods public and deprecates the old ones.

data.title: Breaking api change in minor version
data.body:
Found a breaking change in atom api `::scopesForBufferPosition(bufferPosition)` in 0.133.0 is now `::scopeDescriptorForBufferPosition(bufferPosition)` in 0.146.0. 

Should bump major version or have a method alias for backwards compatibility.

data.title: Feature Request: Be Smart when Opening Files
data.body:
This is a feature of sublime text which I really like. When clicking on a file in the sidebar it works like the following.
- File a is shown, the tab's title is printed in _italics_.
- When opening file b, a is to be closed.

**Let's assume we do this again but we add a particular step in between**
- File a is shown, the tab's title is printed in _italics_.
- Edit file a, the tab's title changes from _italics_ to regular.
- Open file b. File a stays open.

**Double click on file a**
- File a is shown, tab's title in regular.
- Open file b. File a stays open.

This is really useful for browsing files as it does not clutter your tabs bar. Maybe you could add an option to disable this feature.

data.title: Normalize indent on paste with multiple selections
data.body: I found this while working on #4192. The `normalizeIndentOnPaste` option wasn't respected when pasting with multiple selections.

data.title: hiding file name with `~` in tree view
data.body: sometimes vim create a file with `~` , as example `something~`, how to hide this kind of file name in atom ? i tried use in settings>Ignored Names and add `*~` but it still showing in tree view

data.title: how to get the symbol chars from grammar object?
data.body:
This is a cross-post from the discussion group ...

---

Can someone who has worked with grammars tell me how to find the regex or character list that defines a symbol like a variable name? I'm working on a new autocomplete package and I need to parse symbols to go in the suggestion list. I'm looking at the grammar object returned from `editor.getGrammar()` and it is gigantic and confusing to me.

For example in javascript it would be the characters `[a-zA-Z_$]`.

data.title: Use classes on atom-panels rather than location attributes
